page.title: 11WOMEN IN HAWICK
page.content: From the early days of this century the hosiery and tweed, and later the knitwear industry, provided more female than male employment. This gave women an economic independence which extended into their social life and which has led to Hawick being a hive of female activity in the evenings. In addition to golf, tennis, badminton, swimming and Guilds, women have come very much to the fore in bowling, athletics, cycling, fencing, short-tennis, bridge, art, camera, cine-film, drama, music and country dancing clubs. Arch- aelogical and Horticultural Societies, Saxhorn Band and Operatic Society, 50+ and Hill Walking Groups, Red Cross Society, Gas and Electrical Assoc- iations, and supervision in running of youth organisations further extend the opportunity for recreation.
